Lagrangian Points

Named after the Italia astronomer Guiseppe Luigi Lagrancia, the 5 Lagrangian points in a panet's orbit are the only one's that have a stable location and are therefore perfect for observation.Read More

Saturn's Hexagon

Persistent hexagonal cloud pattern was found on the north pole of Saturn. Scientists assume that it is a hurricane that has been there for decades or even centuries.Read More

Black Holes - brightest objects in the Universe?

To find the brightest light you have to look at the darkest places. Accretion discs around black holes produces enough heat to shine hundreds times brighter than galaxies.Read More

Video: Neutron Stars explained!

A beautifully designed animational video explaining the phenomenon of neutron stars.Watch Video
